Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controllers.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputEventListener
public class GameController extends Object implements InputEventListener
The central controller for the Tetris game logic.

This class acts as the Mediator between the Model (Board, Score, History) and the View (UI, Sound). It manages the game loop, input handling, and notifies observers of state changes.

It utilizes the Strategy Pattern via GameMode to support different gameplay styles (e.g., Normal Mode vs. Zen Mode) without modifying the core logic.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()
      Creates a new GameController with a fresh board, score manager, game history stack, and default game mode.

      Observers are not created here; they should be added using addObserver(GameObserver).

  • Method Details

    • setGameMode

      public void setGameMode(GameMode mode)
      Sets the current game mode (normal, timed, endless, etc.). This affects scoring, leveling, undo limits, and whether high scores can be saved.
      Parameters:
      mode - the new game mode to apply

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver(GameObserver observer)
      Registers a new GameObserver to receive UI updates. When added, the observer immediately receives: - background matrix - board view data - current score and level - danger state
      Parameters:
      observer - the observer to register

    • notifyBoard

      private void notifyBoard()

    • notifyBackground

      private void notifyBackground()

    • notifyScore

      private void notifyScore(int score)

    • notifyLevel

      private void notifyLevel(int level)

    • notifyGameOver

      public void notifyGameOver()
      Notifies all observers that the game has ended. If the current mode supports high score saving, the controller will store the new record.

    • notifyBrickDropped

      private void notifyBrickDropped()

    • notifyLineClear

      private void notifyLineClear(int lines, String message)

    • notifyDanger

      private void notifyDanger(boolean isDanger)

    • saveState

      private void saveState()

    • undo

      private void undo()
      Restores the previous board, score, and level state from gameHistory, respecting the undo limit defined by the active GameMode.

      If no previous states are available, nothing happens.

    • handlePieceLanded

      private void handlePieceLanded()
      Handles all logic when a falling piece can no longer move down:
      1. Save current state for undo
      2. Merge brick into background
      3. Clear completed rows
      4. Update score and notify observers
      5. Spawn a new piece
      6. Detect game over

    • onUndoEvent

      public void onUndoEvent()
      Undo input event triggered by the player.
      Specified by:
      onUndoEvent in interface InputEventListener

    • onDownEvent

      public void onDownEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Soft drop event. Moves the brick down by 1 cell. If the brick cannot move further, it triggers landing logic.
      Specified by:
      onDownEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - includes whether the move was caused by the user or gravity

    • onHardDropEvent

      public void onHardDropEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Performs a hard drop (instantly drop to the bottom), updates score, and finalizes the piece.
      Specified by:
      onHardDropEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - includes information about the event source

    • onHoldEvent

      public void onHoldEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles holding the current brick.
      Specified by:
      onHoldEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - contains event source data.

    • onLeftEvent

      public void onLeftEvent()
      Moves the brick left by one cell (if possible).
      Specified by:
      onLeftEvent in interface InputEventListener

    • onRightEvent

      public void onRightEvent()
      Moves the brick right by one cell (if possible).
      Specified by:
      onRightEvent in interface InputEventListener

    • onRotateEvent

      public void onRotateEvent()
      Rotates the brick counter-clockwise.
      Specified by:
      onRotateEvent in interface InputEventListener

    • createNewGame

      public void createNewGame()
      Starts a completely new game. This resets: - board - score - level - undo history - danger state Observers are notified to redraw the board.
      Specified by:
      createNewGame in interface InputEventListener

    • getBoard

      public int[][] getBoard()
      Returns the current board matrix (without the falling brick).
      Specified by:
      getBoard in interface InputEventListener
      Returns:
      2D array representing background tiles of the board
